result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Craig Glann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $518 costs to be paid to Clerk of Courts by 7-27-2017.

All counts concurrent.  Full Huber on all counts.
Stayed-Call Diversion 373-3880 M-F by 6-1-2017; to Report by 7-28-2017.  If not, Commitment to issue without huber  privileges and new criminal charges.
$518 costs to be paid to Clerk of Courts by 7-27-2017.
$443 costs to be paid to Clerk of Courts by 7-27-2017.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Craig Glann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: PD request to clarify JOC to reflect Huber--Court grants full Huber, amend JOC

Defendant Steven Craig Glann in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker and sworn ASL translator Mala Boyce.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea to all counts, Court finds defendant guilty.  PSI WAIVED.  Felon warnings advised.  DNA Order signed.  Court orders:
Ct 1:  1 year Rock Co Jail with diversion; no sentence credit; $1,479 costs due by 7-27-2017 (may begin payment plan after release from custody).
Ct 2:  1 year Rock Co Jail, concurrent with count 1.
Ct 3:  30 days Rock Co Jail, concurrent with counts 1 and 2.
